intro: Matayba camptoneura, commonly known as the narrow-leaf matayba, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Matayba camptoneura is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
